cards.title: Variables Made Simple
cards.description: Learn the basics of storing data in JavaScript variables.
cards.content: Variables are like boxes that store information. In JavaScript, we use 'let' for values that can change and 'const' for values that stay the same.
keyPoints: Use 'const' for values that stay the same
Start variable names with lowercase letters

quiz.question: Which keyword should you use for a value that never changes?
quiz.explanation: Use 'const' for values that never change, like a maximum score or your name.

cards.title: Working with Numbers
cards.description: Learn how to use numbers and basic math in JavaScript.
cards.content: Numbers in JavaScript are simple to work with. You can do math operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
keyPoints: Math.round() rounds to nearest whole number
Numbers can be whole or decimal

quiz.question: What does Math.round(4.7) return?
quiz.explanation: Math.round(4.7) returns 5 because it rounds to the nearest whole number.

cards.title: Text and Strings
cards.description: Learn how to work with text (strings) in JavaScript.
cards.content: Strings are text in JavaScript. You can combine them, make them uppercase or lowercase, and find their length.
keyPoints: Use quotes to create strings: 'text' or "text"
length property tells you how many characters
Methods like toUpperCase() change the text

quiz.question: What does 'Hello'.length return?
quiz.explanation: 'Hello' has 5 characters: H-e-l-l-o, so length returns 5.
